Text: Hear me, O Lord, and answer me, for I am poor and needy.
Context: In this opening verse, the Psalmist is pleading with the Lord, emphasizing his vulnerable state of being ”poor and needy“.

Text: Guard my soul, for I am godly. You my God, save your servant who trusts in You.
Context: Here, the Psalmist expresses his piety (”I am godly“) and his trust in God, asking for protection and deliverance.

Text: Be merciful to me, O Lord, for I call to You all day long.
Context: The Psalmist continuously seeks God’s mercy, indicating a constant state of prayer and dependency on God.

Text: Bring joy to your servant‘s soul, for to You, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
Context: The Psalmist requests joy and upliftment, signaling his devotion as he lifts up his soul to the Lord.

Text: For You, O Lord, are kind and ready to forgive, abundant in loving kindness to all who call on You.
Context: The verse reflects belief in God’s inherent goodness, His readiness to forgive, and His abundant love for those who reach out to Him.

Text: Hear my prayer, O LORD; listen to my cry for mercy.
Context: The Psalmist asks for God‘s attention, implying a need for compassion and God’s response to his prayers.

Text: In the day of my distress I call to you, for you will answer me.
Context: Even in distress, the Psalmist shows confidence that God will respond to his call.

Text: There is none like You among the gods, O Lord, nor are there any works like Yours.
Context: This verse expresses unique admiration for the Lord, suggesting His incomparable nature and deeds.

Text: All the nations You have made will come and bow down before You, O Lord, and they will glorify Your name.
Context: Foretelling universal worship, the Psalmist expects that all nations will eventually recognize and honor God.

Text: For You are great and perform wonders; You alone are God.
Context: Declaration of God‘s grandeur and acknowledgement of His ability to perform wonders, reinforcing monotheistic belief.

Text: Teach me Your way, O LORD, that I may walk in Your truth; unite my heart to fear Your name.
Context: A plea for guidance in God’s truth and a unified heart to properly revere Him.

Text: I will praise You, O Lord my God, with all my heart; I will glorify Your name forever.
Context: Commitment to lifelong praise and glorification of God, emphasizing wholehearted devotion.

Text: For great is Your loving kindness toward me; You have delivered my soul from the depths of Sheol.
Context: Gratitude for God‘s immense kindness and salvation from near death, possibly metaphorical for severe distress.

Text: O God, the arrogant have risen against me; a band of ruthless men seeks my life, they do not set You before them.
Context: Lament about adversaries that pose a threat to life, highlighting their disregard for God.

Text: But You, O Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger and abundant in loving kindness and truth.
Context: Affirmation of God’s nature as compassionate, patient, and characterized by steadfast love and reliability.

Text: Turn to me and be gracious to me; give Your strength to Your servant, and save the son of Your maidservant.
Context: Requesting God‘s favor and strength, invoking the relationship as ”the son of Your maidservant“ to implore deliverance.

Text: Show me a sign of Your favor, that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed, because You, O LORD, have helped me and comforted me.
Context: Asking for a tangible sign of God’s favor to confound enemies and to demonstrate God‘s support and consolation.
